text: Yeah for some reason I nearly always knew I wanted to do a psychology degree. I studied it at A level and loved it but I’ve just always loved learning about how people work and what makes them tick - it comes in super handy at work too! Plus it’s a lot more scientific than people think so for me I was a nice mixture between science and creativity
Yeah I’d say being able to write reports and essays is a really handy skill
I do a lot of business cases and reports that go to board meetings etc now and they need to be well written and researched so that’s a really good skill to have

I did some work experience whilst at university when I worked in the prison service. At school I had a Saturday job and I think I did one week in a design agency place in London which was more formal work experience the school supported us to do
Do you have any work experience yet? Or is there anything you’d be keen to try out?
